# Bird Color Palettes (made with 100% REAL birds!)

birdcolors is a palette generator to spice up your scientific plots (and maybe your life) using the diversity of colors observed across the birds of the world.

Cite us: Tonelli, B.A. (2025) birdcolors: A palette generator of bird colors. R package version 0.0.3.

## Install

```{r,eval=FALSE}
devtools::install_github("bentonelli/birdcolors")
```

## Basic Use

### See what birds are being served today
```{r}
library(birdcolors)
library(ggplot2)

bird_menu()
```

### Plotting with Base R
```{r}
# Base R
outp <- bird_colors("Scarlet Macaw")
xx <- (1:7)
yy <- (1:7)
zz <- (1:7)

plot(xx,yy,col=outp[zz],pch=19,cex=2)
```

### Plotting with ggplot
```{r}
# ggplot2
bird_cols <- bird_colors("Lazuli Bunting",reverse=TRUE)

xx <- (1:8)
yy <- (1:8)
zz <- (1:8)

ggplot() +
  geom_point(aes(x = xx,y=yy,col=zz),pch=19,cex=5) +
  scale_color_bird(bird_cols) +
  theme_classic()
```
